title: When I close and reopen Thunderbird, my appointment times change by ~17 hours
content:
Hi,

Someone sends me a calendar appointment for 11th of May at 16:30-18:30 and another at 18:30:20:30. I accept these appointments. In my calendar, they correctly display at these times.

When I close and re-open Thunderbird, the first appointment is now scheduled for 12th of May, but the second is fine. When I close and re-open Thunderbird again, the second appointment is now scheduled for 12th of May as well.

The times are completely different too.

I'm using Thunderbird 138 from the Arch Linux repositories but I've also tried the Flatpak package to no avail. I've tried setting my Timezone manually and using my System timezone to no avail.

GNOME Calendar, which is also synced to my Caldav server, displays the appointments at the correct day and time. The web interface for my mail server also displays correctly.

It's only Thunderbird that screws it up time and time again.

This has been going on for years and it is driving me insane. I can't use my calendar with Thunderbird because I keep thinking my appointments are at the wrong time!

Send help.
creator: firefox2506

title: Unable to send email via SMTP (smtp.ecozac.it) using Thunderbird
content:
Dear, I’m experiencing an issue when trying to send emails via my SMTP server (smtp.xxxxxx.it) using Thunderbird on macOS. The connection to the SMTP server on port 587 is successful (tested via nc in Terminal), but the email sending fails with the following error: “Sending of the message failed. The connection to the outgoing mail server (SMTP) smtp.xxxxxx.it has timed out.”

These are the SMTP settings I’m using: SMTP server: smtp.xxxxxx.it Port: 587 Connection security: STARTTLS Authentication method: Normal password Username: info@xxxxxx.it

The password is correct and the firewall is disabled.

How can I resolve it?

Thank you in advance for your assistance.
creator: h5xffhzm2h

title: Need to exempt LocalFolder when compacting
content: I have a LocalFolder on a USB stick to move certain mails to, sometimes manually, else using filters on incoming mail. There is no need to compact it. When TB does compacting it fails on the LocalFolder, reporting not being able to compact files.lst. How can I restrict compacting to the mail folders proper only? Since moving emails and reading the archived works flawlessly with LocalFolder, the problem could be related to the owner of the compacting process. Anything I can do to cure that? /HGS

title: Probleem met herinstalleren Gmail account in Thunderbird
content: Beste, Ik gebruik al lange tijd Thunderbird voor meerdere emailadressen (accounts). Onlangs heb ik het wachtwoord van mijn Gmail-account moeten wijzigen. Nadien lukte het uiteraard niet meer om nieuwe mails op deze account binnen te krijgen, aangezien Thunderbird nog het oude wachtwoord gebruikte. Daarom heb ik mijn Gmail account verwijderd uit Thunderbird en nu wil ik het opnieuw installeren, maar dat lukt niet. Ik krijg elke keer weer een foutmelding (400) nadat ik de nieuwe account wil aanmaken. Ondertussen heb ik gevonden waar de wachtwoorden binnen Thunderbird worden bewaard. Daar heb ik de Gmail account ook verwijderd, zodat dit niet interfereert met de nieuwe installatie. Maar desondanks blijft er een foutmelding komen wanneer ik mijn Gmail wil installeren. Enig idee wat er gaande is? Of kan ik best Thunderbird in zijn geheel verwijderen en opnieuw installeren op mijn laptop? Dankjewel voor jullie hulp! Veerle
creator: veerlewauters

title: Thunderbird storing offline emails
content:
Thunderbird is taking up around 40gb on my computer with emails that have been downloaded for offline viewing.

I only ever use my computer when it is connected to the internet and do not need the emails downloaded for offline viewing.

I have right clicked every folder and went in to "Properties" -> "Synchronization" and have made sure that "Select This Folder For Offline Use" is unchecked

Have I done something wrong? I dont want any emails to be stored locally. Ideally, I only want emails to be displayed virtually How do I achieve this?

title: POP3 Until I delete setting
content:
On support page accesible at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/configuration-options-accounts, it says in "Leave messages on server" paragraph as below:

"Set Until I delete them to delete messages from the server when you delete them from Thunderbird."

When I do so Thunderbird initiates server delete immediately upon moving the message from inbox to Trash either via delete key or moving to that folder specifically. I was expecting it would initiate delete once the message is deleted from Trash folder as my previous e-mail client prior to installing Thunderbird. I like it but this is either a confusing behavior not explained well in manuals or ssettings screen or there might be a bug. Please let me know which is the case.

PS: I use Thunderbird Mac 128.10

title: Mozilla Thunderbird Want To Access Your Google Account - I don't Waant to
content:
About every five minutes, this message pops up obliterating anything I'm doing on my computer, whether in email or on the internet and I have to go to the task bar and highlight Thunderbird until that message appears on the task bar, then I can delete. Many times, it immediately comes right back on the screen and I have to do it a second time. 

                                      'Mozilla Thunderbird wants to Access your Google Account' 
                                                                 My Gmail Address Appears here 
                                                          This will allow Mozilla Thunderbird Email to: 
                                              See, edit, share and permanently delete all the calendars                                               you can access using Google Calendar 
                       By clicking Allow, you allow this app and Google to use your information in accordance                        with their respective privacy policies.  You can change this and other account                         permissions anytime.

But you CAN'T change anything like it says.

These are most annoying and come up at the most inopportune times when I'm trying to work on something on my computer and it obliterates the entire screen.

Joe - Oklahoma
